results.title: Mona Lisa descending a staircase
results.creator_credit: Joan C. Gratz, National Endowment for the Arts, American Film Institute and Pyramid Film and Video
results.brief_description: Using the innovative technique of clay painting, artist and filmmaker Joan Gratz takes the viewer on an entertaining and colourful journey through the development of Modern Art. Starting with the brilliant landscapes and haunting self-portraits of impressionism, “Mona Lisa descending a staircase” moves through cubism and surrealism, then finishes with vibrant images of contemporary pop art and hyper-realism. Featuring some 55 paintings and 35 artists from Van Gogh to Warhol, the video shifts seamlessly from image to image to make this artistic presentation as emotionally gripping as it is visually fascinating.

results.title: Max et les Ferrailleurs = Max and the Scrap Merchants
results.creator_credit: Claude Sautet, Raymond Danon and Ralph Baum
results.brief_description:
Max is a cop obsessed with catching criminals ‘in the act’. After a few misfortunes, he turns his attention to small time criminals. Abel, a childhood friend of Max is running a scam with a gang of metal scrappers. Unbeknownst to Abel, Max becomes acquainted with his girlfriend Lily, a prostitute. For Lily, Max becomes Felix, a rich bank manager and a regular client. Slowly, Felix/Max feeds Lily information about his bank in order to incite Abel and his gang to commit a failsafe hit.

Credits: Producers, Ralph Baum, Raymond Danon ; director, Claude Sautet ; writers, Claude Neron, Jean-Loup Dabadie, Claude Sautet ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Romy Schneider, Michel Piccoli, Bernard Fresson, Francois Perier, Georges Wilson, Bobby Lapointe, Michel Creton, Dany Jacquet, Betty Beckers, Philippe Leotard.

results.title: Mona Lisa
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, Patrick Cassavetti, Palace Pictures and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: Bob Hoskins plays a small-time con, just out of prison, who is delivering porn videos for a living. He gets a job as a minder to call-girl, Simone, (Cathy Tyson) and soon finds he is falling in love with her and assisting her to find her friend, Cathy, a young prostitute who has disappeared. A stylish film-noir set in contemporary London, “Mona Lisa” is also a challenging film about honour, responsibility and compassion in a society that is decaying and cruel. Cast also includes Michael Caine and Robbie Coltrane.

results.title: One hundred and one dalmatians = 101 dalmations
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi, Hamilton Luske, Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Pongo and Perdita settle into their owner’s home and become the proud parents of fifteen beautiful dalmation puppies. Cruella De Vil thinks that the litter would make a perfect dogskin coat and with the help of her henchmen, steals the puppies. Pongo and Perdita and their canine friends, embark on a dangerous rescue mission, and at last are reunited with their children and more dalmations! Based on the novel by Dodie Smith. Features the voices of Rod Taylor, Betty Lou Gerson, Cate Bauer, Lisa Daniels, Ben Wright and others.

results.title: Mon oncle Antoine
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marc Beaudet, National Film Board of Canada and Gendon Films
results.brief_description: There was a time when the general store was the crossroads of life, a place where a boy could learn all he needed for the way ahead - especially when his uncle was the storekeeper, and also the undertaker, and the nephew often called upon to lend a hand. This film recalls such a store in a village in the asbestos mining area of Quebec in the early 1940s. The film presents a hundred-and-one vignettes of village life - all the bitter-sweet nostalgia with which a man might remember the events that thrust him into manhood. Mon oncle Antoine is about a Quebec that makes no headlines but reflects the whole of life, the ebb and flow of hope and despair that might be in anyone’s memory. (Awards: Fifteen awards including Moscow; Chicago; Toronto) In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Mommie dearest
results.creator_credit: Frank Perry, Frank Yablans, Frank Yablans Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Faye Dunaway stars as screen legend Joan Crawford in this biographical feature about Joan’s life from her adopted daughter’s point of view. Joan Crawford was a powerful star produced by the Hollywood Studio System but as the old saying goes, money can’t buy happiness and she yearned to be a mother. As a single woman she adopted children but her dependence on alcohol led to the alleged abuse of the children and her personality at home is revealed to be controlling and overbearing. Script is based on the tell-all novel “Mommie Dearest” by Christina Crawford. Also stars Diana Scarwid as the older Christina.

results.title: Molokai: the story of 'Father Damien' [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Grietje Lammertyn, Tharsi Vanhuysse, Jos Stelling Films and CVBA Damien
results.brief_description: Dramatised account of the life of Belgian priest Father Damien (David Wenham) who voluntarily moved to the Hawaiian Island of Molokai to tend the spiritual needs of the 19th Century leper colony. At the time leprosy was untreatable and speculations were raised as to how the scourge was contracted: it was rumoured to be the second stage of syphilis. In a pique of frustration, a decision was made by the government to send all suspected victims to Molokai. On Molokai Father Damien initiates moves to improve the living conditions of the inhabitants, including adequate shelter and food, and rumours soon spread of his generosity, generating public support for the Christian hero. Featuring an impressive international cast and stunning locations, “Molokai” languorously captures the life of a compassionate man who cared for the lives of lepers despite resistance from the religious and political powers that be. Based on the biography by Hilde Eynikel. Cast also includes: Kate Cebrano, Jan Decleir, Alice Krige, Tom Wilkinson, Sam Neill, Leo McKern, Derek Jacobi, Chris Haywood, Aden Young.

results.title: Molly Mae faces backlash
results.brief_description: Influencer and former Love Island contestant, Molly- Mae Hague, faces backlash after a clip of her talking about her work ethic went viral. During a podcast interview she implied that poverty is linked to laziness, claiming that “everyone has the same 24 hours”.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Influencer and former Love Island contestant, Molly- Mae Hague, faced backlash after a clip of her talking about her work ethic went viral. During a podcast interview she implied that poverty is linked to laziness, claiming that “everyone has the same 24 hours”.

At a moment when people are suffering the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic, including the inability to work because of lockdowns and quarantine orders (not to mention inequality growing globally), the comment was more than a little tone deaf.

As the Mirror reports: “Many others fumed over the fact that Molly-Mae claims she works hard when she was appointed Creative Director of Pretty Little Thing which is a company that is owned by Boo Hoo Group – who got busted in 2020 for ‘modern day slavery’ for paying employees just £3.50 per hour.”

Check out the original story on ScreenShotHQ’s Instagram for more details and reactions.

results.title: Max floating to songs
results.brief_description: Stranger Things has introduced Zoomers to another 80s icon: pop star Kate Bush. In season four, Max (Sadie Sink) is saved from villain Vecna’s spell by her friends playing Bush’s “Running Up That Hill”. Not only did the scene shoot the song into Billboard’s top 10 for the first time in 37 years, it’s been adopted by internet users who’ve wondered what song would save them. One Twitter account tried answer that question by remixing contemporary songs into the scene, showing how online ingenuity can bridge the cultural past & present while allowing viewers to participate in moving image making.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Stranger Things has introduced Zoomers to another 80s icon: pop star Kate Bush. In season four, Max (Sadie Sink) is saved from villain Vecna’s spell by her friends playing Bush’s “Running Up That Hill”. Not only did the scene shoot the song into Billboard’s top 10 for the first time in 37 years, it’s been adopted by internet users who’ve wondered what song would save them. One Twitter account tried answer that question by remixing contemporary songs into the scene, showing how online ingenuity can bridge the cultural past and present while allowing viewers to participate in moving image making.

Social media users across the internet have also used special effects programs to show themselves levitating, or running out of the Upside Down from Vecna, often to their favourite songs, which they’ve edited into the visuals. This has allowed the scene to spawn numerous meme templates.

The personal element of the narrative - that your favourite song can save you from evil - and the nostalgia of the series lends itself to users contributing their own songs (and associated emotions) to the visuals, creating a personal but collective, shareable experience.

Another prominent meme created from Stranger Things 4 relies on sound. Before claiming his victims, Vecna makes them hallucinate a ticking grandfather clock (among other things) and its ominous chime (used to great effect in horror movies forever) has become an eerie indicator that he’s coming for you. Naturally, TikTokers have appropriated the sound for comedic effect. Know Your Meme traces the first use of it to user @marcusbtv, who hears it in a skit about gaming, removes one headphone and says “Nope….. not getting me”, before going back to playing.

It’s now been repurposed and reused across the internet, with users often engaging with an invisible clock (they’re hallucinating) or even Big Ben.

results.title: One hand clapping
results.creator_credit: Joan Henson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Noise pollution is a scourge of our time no less than are the visible forms that contaminate our environment. From the jangle of the alarm clock to the din of downtown, noise assails us throughout the day. The way the film depicts this aural enemy provides overpowering, at times amusing, evidence that here, too, the time has come to call a halt. Cast includes Ghislaine Phaneuf, Don Scanlan, Griffith Brewer, Dave Broadfoot, Sonny Cullen, Don Arioli, Judith Gault.
